-	Motivated achiever and proven bottom-line contributor with solid record of cost reductions through process redesign, savvy contract negotiation, organizational reengineering, and value engineering utilizing Lean Process Improvements. 
-	Visionary leader and highly capable change-agent that consistently refines and revitalizes strategies and procedures, introduces innovation, change management, and facilitates solutions-driven team collaboration.

-	Superior management methods and practices for planning, budgeting, scheduling; monitoring performance and evaluating results.

Responsibilities include planning, directing, and coordinating activities; project scope, schedules, approval requirements, project budgets, quality and change controls. Develops timeline of project approval requirements. Interacts with customer staff, coordinates resources and schedule. Manages design output, design budgets, and performance management of the architectural and engineering vendors. Assures accuracy of financial forecasts with tie-in to project schedules. Manages the indirect budget, forecasts trades resources, resolves resource conflicts, and coordinates trades mobilization. Engages in incident investigation, staff safety and IP training, and project assessment. Ensures the project is completed according to project plans and budget. Manages project team resourcing and training.  
 
Key Accomplishments: 
-	The CH8 Team was the recipient of the TMG Excellence Award for delivering Intel’s first ever Substrate Facility while beating very challenging affordability and schedule targets. 
-	Implementing Intel’s first Integrated Project Delivery Team in Chandler.  
-	Employing Lean Principles - Partnering with the factory, Tiffany contributed to establishing one set of training classes for both factories saving approximately 5,170 valuable labor hours annually across the Chandler campus. Tiffany implemented the LEAN Team which provides collaboration with trade partners, designers, EHS, and PM’s and whose goal was to find and implement lean changes across the Chandler campus. In 2014, this team has generated a total of 237 ideas and implemented a total of 144 on the Chandler campus.  
-	Tiffany took on the challenge of obtaining LEED Gold certification which was achieved for the CH8 Chandler Facility at no additional cost. The original goal was to achieve LEED Silver. Summary I'm a passionate problem solver with emphasis in software and technology. 
 
From an early age, I've been working on solving problems for others. I worked on bikes for the neighborhood kids to fix problems ranging from flat tires to gears. While working on my bachelor's degree at St Martin's, I noticed that they didn't have someone to maintain the computers in the computer lab. So I offered to be their computer lab support and in exchange they covered the cost of one of my classes each semester. They agreed and helped pay for my bachelor's degree. 
 
Going through college, I am among a select few who can claim that I did it without grants, loans, or  
help from my parents. I was with the US Army for 12 years and used my GI Bill to pay for my Bachelor's degree. While I worked for Intel, they covered the cost of my MBA. I worked and used the resources available to cover my college expenses. Hence, I graduated with both my Bachelors and my Masters degree completely debt free. 
 
With Intel, this has transferred over and I've worked to solve the problems that both Intel has and their customers. I've worked as technical support for large customers and internally, helped to save Intel $10M by implementing a program in the factory to reuse items in the construction process. As a PMP-certified project manager with over 10 years of experience, I've worked on budgets to stay within the defined amounts while meeting the project schedule. 
 
I love being creative and coming up with alternative solutions to complex problems. So send me a message and we can talk about how I can help you.

Summary Under Annette Tippeconnie’s leadership, Nike’s workplace is experiencing a global transformation. As GM of Workplace Design + Connectivity for Nike WHQ GEO, she leads in a critical role to create a workplace strategy that will unleash the creativity and potential of all employees by leveraging, building on and enhancing the company’s existing assets in physical space, services and connectivity solutions to create a work environments that will propel Nike to the forefront of new ways of working.  
 
Annette ensures that the Nike Workplace Design + Connectivity team leverages the systems, design thinking and key partnerships across the company to drive change, strengthen global operations and accelerate progress towards Nike’s strategic business objectives. She accomplishes this by driving geography level standards to ensure design excellence and delivery of innovative solutions to meet the company’s business and employee needs.  
 
By leading a large cross-functional team and through strategic engagement with senior Nike leaders, Annette is expertly managing the Workplace Design + Connectivity WHQ portfolio to influence the operational and strategic direction of Nike’s real estate holdings. Previously, Annette was the Director of Americas Real Estate Development where she was responsible for managing all of Nike’s non-retail real estate across all brands within the US, Canada, Mexico, South America, Brazil and Latin America.  
 
Prior to joining Nike, Inc., Annette held senior Real Estate positions in other Fortune 100 companies such as Microsoft and Intel, where her expertise in people and business management, design and construction management and strategic leadership have afforded her the opportunity to make significant contributions while continuing to expand her portfolio of skills. Through these experiences, Annette has honed her client relationship management and executive engagement skills, analytical problem solving in global markets and change management.
